Language: en
Accessibility

Functions

Three targets are created in the shape of black circles. There is a gradient from white to black from the center of the circle to the outer edge.

The drawTarget() function makes it easy to draw many distinct targets. Each call to drawTarget() specifies the position, size, and number of rings for each target.


function setup() {
  createCanvas(720, 400);
  background(51);
  noStroke();
  noLoop();
}

function draw() {
  drawTarget(width * 0.25, height * 0.4, 200, 4);
  drawTarget(width * 0.5, height * 0.5, 300, 10);
  drawTarget(width * 0.75, height * 0.3, 120, 6);
}

function drawTarget(xloc, yloc, size, num) {
  const grayvalues = 255 / num;
  const steps = size / num;
  for (let i = 0; i < num; i++) {
    fill(i * grayvalues);
    ellipse(xloc, yloc, size - i * steps, size - i * steps);
  }
}
